BackstoryDef.title: warmaster
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was warmaster to a mid-level royal house. [PAWN_pronoun] oversaw military aspects of the family's strategy. \nOn the rare occasion a battle occurred, [PAWN_nameDef] directed the military commanders.

BackstoryDef.title: regent
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: When [PAWN_nameDef]'s family's ally was killed, and [PAWN_possessive] young son inherited his throne, [PAWN_nameDef] was appointed as regent to rule in the child's stead. \n[PAWN_pronoun] oversaw diverse matters of house and title, from finances to war to greedy relatives intent on usurping the throne. [PAWN_nameDef] never abused [PAWN_possessive] position.

BackstoryDef.title: beastmaster
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef]'s family had more children than they had proper titles to inherit. Being of low rank in the birth order, [PAWN_nameDef] was given the honorary title of beastmaster. \n[PAWN_nameDef] managed the family's extensive menagerie. While [PAWN_pronoun] never worked hands-on with the beasts, [PAWN_pronoun] connected with them. Few others appreciated [PAWN_objective] the way they did.

BackstoryDef.title: arts patron
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] managed [PAWN_possessive] family's investments in the arts. \n[PAWN_pronoun] chose artists to patronize and worked with them to produce the expressions that most glorify [PAWN_possessive] family, the Imperial church, and the Empire itself.

BackstoryDef.title: spymaster
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: As soon as [PAWN_pronoun] was old enough, [PAWN_nameDef] was given the post of spymaster for [PAWN_possessive] house. [PAWN_possessive] cold, calculating nature made [PAWN_objective] a natural at the arts of blade, poison, and betrayal.

BackstoryDef.title: landworker
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] held the position of landworker in [PAWN_possessive] royal house. [PAWN_pronoun] managed the family's lands and all the resources on them - both agricultural and mineral. \nThough [PAWN_pronoun] would never work the machines [PAWN_objective]self, managing these enterprises required learning the methods of farming and mining in detail.
